resources.string: Welcome to Shark. Press the Start button to begin the packet capture.

Shark is an Android GUI for TCPdump and Jnetpcap.

Author: Sergio Jiménez Feijóo (sergio.jf89@gmail.com)

Shark is free software licensed under the GNU GPL.
Shark is running. Since the packet capture is being saved in a file TCPdump\'s standard output is disabled. When the capture it\'s finished you can find the results file in /mnt/sdcard/
Starting Shark. It might take a few seconds...
Shark has detected that your device isn\'t rooted. TCPdump was not launched.
An error has been produced when trying to execute the command. TCPdump was not launched.
An error has been produced when trying to flush the output stream.
An unknown error has been produced.
Shark has detected that your device isn\'t connected to any network. Shark won\'t be able to capture packets unless you are connected to a network. ¿Would you like to do so now?
An error has been produced when trying to close the shell.
An error has been produced when waiting for the process to finish.
Shark has detected that a capture is in progress right now. In order to open the reader you must stop it.\n\nWould you like to do so now?
Shark has detected that the file that you are trying to open doesn\'t exist. Make a capture with the \'save packets to a file\' option enabled.
Shark has detected that you have changed your settings while a capture was running. The new settings won\'t take effect until you stop the current capture and start a new one.
"Network connection went down while TCPdump was active. TCPdump was stopped."
TCPdump has started the packet capture
Shark couldn\'t install TCPdump\'s executable in your device. This may have been caused because your device isn\'t rooted. Shark won\'t be able to capture packets.
